Documentation

This website has been made according the task 1 of web publication subject. It's been compiled using Jekyll 3.7.4 as newer version 3.8.5 allowed using liquid in a way that does not work on GitHub pages yet.

  • 3 layouts

All layouts are based on main layout in /_layouts/parent.html. Then the 3 main layouts are

  • Default in /_layouts/default.html - main subpages use this layout. It includes main menu header and footer. Other than that it's simply content. e.g. Home

  • About in /_layouts/about.html - used by About posts. Contains double top menu, one for main navigation and other for navigation between About me posts. Uses cycle for generating gallery, which can be filled by using variable "typefilt" in each post. The gallery is situated under the main content of post. e.g. Cooking

  • Project in /_layouts/project.html - used by project posts. Header and footer are not used, instead there is a link to Home and Back to projects page. This is also a double column layout, with pictures in the left column being linked with for cycle through datafile and content, mainly text in the right part. e.g. Chess

    • 5 subpages

    The pages listed in the main navigation menu in the top of the website are different subpages. In addition to that, there are multiple subpages in the form of markdown posts in About me and Projects pages.

    • 5 variables

    The cycle for picture showing in "/_posts/2019-03-03-about_gardening.md" contains 5 variables - photo and it's subvariables photo.type, photo.short, photo.path and photo.desc. Other variables are used to define which picture types belong to each post. There are more variables throughout the website.

    • Data file

    Data file used is "/_data/images.yml". It's main purpose is to keep track of all images and be able to discern between their respective types, therefore using simple cycles to show all relevant pictures everywhere they're needed.
